page.title: 08LIVING IN CHALFORD
page.content: I like living in Chalford because it has so many steep woods and fields.The village is very long with lots of narrow,twisty roads and drystone walls.There is a Roundhouse by the canal that canal workers used to live in.This old village in the Golden Valley is sometimes said to be the second largest village in England.Most of the houses are built from Cotswold stone which used to be quarried locally. People here have television but,if you live in the valley,you will get poor reception because of the hills. I like to see the gliders which are often flying overhead from the Gliding Cub at the old Aerodrome at Aston Down.You can also watch trains travelling through the valley to and from London.
